result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa J. Patten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Proceedings. Plea and Sentencing held April 7, 2016

Defendant Lisa J. Patten in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Lisa J. Patten in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF68 & 15CF56.  Victim rights have been comply with.  Plea agreement 15CF68 plea to ct 4 & 5 and balance of counts to be dismissed and read in.  15CF56 to be dismissed and read in.  Recommend 6yr, 3 yrs initial conf and 3 yrs extend on each court to run concurrent.  Concurrent to present sentence.  No credit.  Restitution to be determined & cost.  Def understands agreement and agrees.  Waiver of preliminary.  Form completed, reviewed with def.  Court explains preliminary hearing.  Def waives right to preliminary.  Court accepts waiver,  Court finds probable cause, bound over for 15CF68.  Information filed   Copy received and waive reading.  Plea questionnaire form reviewed with def.  15CF68 Ct 4 - Guilty plea.  Ct 5 - Guilty plea.  Court will dismiss 15CF56.  Court will dismiss Ct 1, 2, 3 and 6, 7 & 8 dismissed and read in.  Constitutional rights and  right jury trial  reviewed.  Elements  & penalties reviewed.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Stipulate to facts to criminal complaint   Court will accept pleas, found guilty  Ct 4 & 5.   Sentencing arguments by State.  Atty Schuster presents sentencing arguments.  Statement by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  Court orders Ct 4 6 prison, 3 yr initial , 3 yr extended.  Cost. concurrent.  DNA surcharge  Restitution joint & several.  State has 60 days to determine amount.  Reserve right for hearing.  Ct 5 6 yrs prison.  3 yr initial, 3 yrs extended.  Concurrent.  Cost and restitution.  Joint & serveral.  No DNA surcharge.  Def is eligible for both programs, challenge & substance abuse.  Felony rights reviewed.  Post conviction rights.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Warrants vacted on both cases.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution
